de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.graphs.model

Interface Node<NodeType extends Node<NodeType,VectorType>,VectorType extends Vector>

  • Type Parameters:
    NodeType - The node type that is defined for neighbors of this node.
    VectorType - The vector that is used to define the position of this node.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Atom, StructuralEntity<T>, Substructure<SubstructureType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNode, AminoAcid, AtomContainer, BioNode, BranchSubstructure, Chain, GenericNode, LeafSubstructure, MoleculeAtom, Nucleotide, RegularAtom, RegularNode, StructuralModel, StructuralMotif, UncertainAtom

    public interface Node<NodeType extends Node<NodeType,VectorType>,VectorType extends Vector>
    The node is the elementary object contained in graphs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNeighbour(NodeType node)
      Adds a neighbour to this node.
      int getDegree()
      Returns the degree (the number of neighbours) of the node.
      int getIdentifier()
      Returns the identifier of the node.
      java.util.List<NodeType> getNeighbours()
      Returns all neighbors of this node.
      VectorType getPosition()
      Returns the position of the node.
      void setPosition(VectorType position)
      Sets the position of the node.

      • addNeighbour

        void addNeighbour(NodeType node)
        Adds a neighbour to this node. This method should always be called in conjunction with adding an edge to the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - The new neighbour
